definitions.definition: a number of people or things that are located close together or are considered or classed together.
examples: these bodies fall into four distinct groups
synonyms: status "the exhibits were divided into three distinct groups"crowd

definitions.definition: a number of people who work together or share certain beliefs.
examples: I now belong to my local drama group
synonyms: splinter group More"a coup attempt by a group within the legislature"association

definitions.definition: a commercial organization consisting of several companies under common ownership.
examples: association, club, society, league, guild, circle, union, sorority, fraternity the women's group

definitions.definition: a number of musicians who play popular music together.
examples: band, ensemble, act; Moreinformalcombo, outfit "a local singing group"Morecombo, outfit a local singing group

definitions.definition: a unit of the US Air Force, consisting of two or more squadrons.
a unit of the US Army, consisting of two or more battalions.
two or more figures or objects forming a design.
a set of elements occupying a column in the periodic table and having broadly similar properties arising from their similar electronic structure.
a combination of atoms having a recognizable identity in a number of compounds.
a set of elements, together with an associative binary operation, that contains an inverse for each element and an identity element.
a stratigraphic division consisting of two or more formations.
put together or place in a group or groups.
examples: three wooden chairs were grouped around a dining table
synonyms: dispose "extra chairs were grouped around the table"

examples: we group them into species merely as a convenience
synonyms: triage "patients were grouped according to their symptoms"

examples: many growers began to group together to form cooperatives
